required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of TG103 in Chinese Healthy Adult Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single Ascending Dose Phase Ia Study in Chinese Healthy Adult Subjects to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic of TG103

lead_sponsor.agency: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock:
The main purposes of this study are to determine:
1. To assess the safety and tolerability of a single subcutaneous injection of different doses of TG103 in healthy Chinese adult subjects.
2. The pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic characteristics of a single subcutaneous injection of different doses of TG103 in healthy Chinese adult subjects were assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with One or More Serious Adverse Event(s) (SAEs) Considered by the Investigator to be Related to Study Drug Administration
primary_outcome.description: A summary of SAEs and other non-serious adverse events (AEs), regardless of causality, will be reported in the Reported Adverse Events module

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) after administration of of TG103
Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) after administration of of TG103
Time to maximum plasma concentration（Tmax）after administration of of TG103
The half time of TG103 after administration are calculated.
To assess the apparent clearance (CL/F) after administration of TG103
Changes in Fasting blood glucose compared to baseline
Changes in 2-hour postprandial blood glucose compared to baseline
Changes in fasting insulin compared to baseline
Changes in fasting glucagon compared to baseline

arm_group.description: Escalating doses of TG103 administered subcutaneously (SC) once in healthy participants.
Placebo administered SC once in healthy participants.
